slides.title: CSS Transitions
Transition Properties
slides.content:
# Transition Properties ‚öôÔ∏è

- `transition-property`: width, color, all
- `transition-duration`: 2s, 500ms
- `transition-timing-function`: ease, linear, ease-in, ease-out
- `transition-delay`: 1s (Wait before starting)

## Shorthand
`transition: width 2s ease-in 1s;`
(property duration timing delay)

slides.title: Timing Functions
slides.content:
# Timing Functions ‚è≥

Specifies the speed curve of the transition effect.

- `linear`: Same speed from start to end.
- `ease` (default): Slow start, then fast, then slow end.
- `ease-in`: Slow start.
- `ease-out`: Slow end.
- `ease-in-out`: Slow start and end.

```css
transition-timing-function: ease-in-out;
```

slides.title: CSS Animations
Applying Animations
Keyframe Percentages
Animation Iteration
slides.content:
# Looping Animations üîÑ

`animation-iteration-count` specifies the number of times an animation should run.

- `animation-iteration-count: 3;` (Runs 3 times)
- `animation-iteration-count: infinite;` (Runs forever)

## Direction
`animation-direction: alternate;` (Plays forward then backward)

slides.title: 2D/3D Transforms
slides.content:
# Transforms üîÑ

Transforms allow you to translate, rotate, scale, and skew elements.

- `translate(x, y)`: Moves element.
- `rotate(angle)`: Rotates element.
- `scale(x, y)`: Resizes element.
- `skew(x-angle, y-angle)`: Skews element.

```css
div:hover {
  transform: scale(1.5) rotate(45deg);
}
```
Often combined with transitions for smooth effects!

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üé¨

Animations create engaging interfaces.

## Key Takeaways

- ‚úÖ **Transitions:** Smoothly change distinct values (e.g., hover color).
- ‚úÖ **@keyframes:** Define complex animation sequences.
- ‚úÖ **Iteration:** Control how many times it loops (`infinite`).
- ‚úÖ **Transforms:** Move, rotate, and scale elements without affecting layout flow.
